6:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold mb-6","children":["About ","San Juan"]}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground text-lg leading-relaxed","children":"San Juan is Mendoza's quieter, more affordable neighbor in the Cuyo wine region. The province produces excellent Syrah and Torrontés, with the Tulum Valley wine route offering tastings without the tourist crowds of Mendoza. The star natural attraction is Ischigualasto — the Valley of the Moon — a UNESCO World Heritage site with surreal rock formations and some of the most important dinosaur fossils ever discovered (230 million years old). The Calingasta Valley offers stargazing that rivals Chile's Atacama, and the Barreal Blanco salt flat is a natural wonder. For expats, San Juan offers an authentic Cuyo lifestyle at rock-bottom prices, though infrastructure is more basic than Mendoza."}]]}]}]}]
